page.title: 07Roger Bickley's Talk
page.content: Roger Bickley is a water bailiff. He works for the South West Water Authority. Mr Bickley visits reservoiurs, lakes and rivers.His work includes a variety of unusual tasks, the most exciting being that of a "water policeman". There are many valuble salmon and sea trout swim in the estury on their way up and down the rivers{Taw}and{ {Torridge.}Only 17 men are licensed to fish the estury using small rowing boats and seine nets. These men have to fish only at certain times and they can only operate with an approved net. Unfortunatly, salmon poachers plunder the quiet, remote parts of the rivers because salmon is so valuable. Mr Bickley brought a frozen salmon to show us. It had been used as evidence in court to convict some poachers.
